page.title: 11Strawberry picking at Gatton
page.content: The people who go stawberry picking at Whitehall Fruit Farm buy a basket or bring their own. If you buy a basket it will cost 8p for a small one, 12p for a middle sized one or 15p for a large one. The farmer says not to eat the strawberries as you are picking them, but people still do, without anyone noticing. When they have enough they go to the lady sitting under the umbrella, she will weigh them and take the money like a shop keeper does. She uses {electronic scales}to make sure how many there are and to calculate the right price. The stawberries cost{58p {a pound}and most people think its fun picking them. Not all the fruit grown at the farm is sold in this way, a lot of it is picked by workers and sent off to {market.
